[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 95]
Reasoning: **Deep Dive: Pack Selection Strategy**

Okay, here's the situation: Ante 4/8, Round 8. Standard pack, two picks. First pick was the Red Seal Queen of Hearts – excellent, especially with my current Joker setup (Smiley Face, Photograph, Hanging Chad, Stuntman, Pareidolia). The Red Seal on the first card is a huge boon for that Photograph/Chad/Smiley Face combo. I've got $51, and two consumables: Justice and The World.

Now for my second pick. The options are: the 10 of Diamonds (Blue Seal), the Ace of Clubs (Foil), 3 of Hearts, and the 9 of Hearts (Lucky Card).

The 10 of Diamonds is the clear winner here. That Blue Seal is critical. At the end of the round, if held, it'll create a Planet card for my final hand, which is usually a high card or a flush, so it will scale incredibly well into the next rounds. The Ace of Clubs provides +50 chips, but that's not as impactful with Stuntman. The 9 of Hearts is okay, but not as good as the Blue Seal for long-term scaling.

Wait, I need to make sure I have space for the planet card! I have a full consumable inventory. I'll need an empty consumable slot at the *end* of the round to receive the Planet card. It's safe to select the card now, though. I can sell or use a consumable later.

I'm comparing the 10 of Diamonds (Blue Seal) to the Ace of Clubs (Foil). The Blue Seal is significantly better. It's rank 10, the Queen was rank 12, but Pareidolia makes them both face cards anyway.

Okay, select the 10 of Diamonds. Position 1.

No reason to skip this selection. No need to use or sell a consumable right now. I'm happy with my current Joker order; it prioritizes additive Mult from Smiley Face before multiplicative Mult from Photograph. Just double checking my scoring logic, here: played cards score left to right, with each card doing the following: base chips -> card modifiers -> on score jokers -> retriggers, and all that repeats for the retrigger. My retrigger Joker is the Hanging Chad and it works as expected.

I am selecting the 10 of Diamonds (Blue Seal). That's my final action: `{"action": "select", "positions": [1]}`. That card is definitely the 10 of Diamonds, which *does* create a Planet card at the end of the round, confirming the plan. Checking the 9 of Hearts, just to be sure... it has no seal. It's a no-brainer. This is the optimal play. `{"action": "select", "positions": [1]}`. That's the correct move!

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
buy_card <card_position> - Buy a card from the card section. Individual Joker cards are also bought from the card section.
buy_booster <booster_pack_position> - Buy a booster pack from the booster pack section.
buy_voucher <voucher_position> - Buy a voucher from the voucher section.
buy_and_use_consumable <consumable_position> - Buy a consumable type card (Tarot, Planet, Spectral) from the card section and use it immediately. Cannot do this if the consumable requires target hand cards.
round_select - Finish shopping and go to the round select screen.
reroll_shop - Spends the reroll cost to reroll the cards section of the shop.

**Final Preparations for the Psychic**

Okay, here's the game plan. We're in Ante 4, Round 8, sitting pretty with $47. The engine is humming along thanks to a solid Joker lineup: Smiley Face, Photograph, Hanging Chad, Stuntman (Holo!), and Pareidolia. We just clocked a sweet 60k High Card last round, and we're looking to replicate that dominance against "The Psychic" boss.

The key to this round is going to be optimizing the Joker order to maximize the multiplier. We've got Pareidolia turning everything into face cards, setting off the rest of the engine. Here's the sequence we're going with: Smiley Face (+5 mult on face) -> Photograph (X2 mult on first face) -> Hanging Chad (Retriggers). Then comes Stuntman.

My hand size is 6, thanks to Stuntman's -2. The Psychic requires 5 cards played, so that leaves 1 card in hand. The ideal scenario is that this final card is my Blue Seal, which can give me the Planet card.

Now, we need to clear a consumable slot for that Planet card, so the first thing I'll do is sell "The World". This is a no-brainer, and I have to act now. I'm going with `sell_consumable 2`. It seems that the best path to winning is to focus my energy on that, and save any unnecessary shop actions until after the sell.

Alright, the next thing is just to move to the next round. I'll take a final look at the shop for other options but, with the engine and the clear path of selling the consumable, I'm going with `round_select`.

It's going to be a good round. Let's do this!
